page.title: 13 Country park
page.content: Following work on a Riverside Plan in 1983 an area in the south east of the block was approved by Gillingham Borough Council as a "country park"in 1985. The park will extend along the river shore north of the coastal or Lower Rainham road. The park is intended to be a blend of continuing agricultural and recreational use. Among the planned activities are horse riding, fishing and rambling. There is an information centre near the park and the whole area is monitored by a full-time ranger.At present (July 1985) while some of the facilities are in place and in use,the park still awaits its formal opening.
